links.title: China Could Steer Self-Driving Cars
links.description: In China, the cars are becoming smarter. Last week, Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and Foxconn Technology Co. Ltd. led a $348 million fundraising round for Guangzhou Xiaopeng Motors Technology Co. Ltd., a three-year-old startup developing internet-connected, electric cars. The investment might seem an odd one for online retailer Alibaba.

links.title: Feb-05-2018 - Weekend Edition - Equity, Sectors & Earnings
links.description: The markets finally got the correction everyone was looking for this past week. The major indices retreated back to levels not seen since the second week of January. And just like with the move higher, the underlying indices also participated in this most recent decline.

$TSLA https://bgr.com/2018/02/03/tesla-powerwall-where-to-buy-home-depot/

links.title: Tesla is about to start selling solar panels at Home Depot
links.description: With all the focus on the Model 3 and Tesla's new Semi truck, it's easy to forget that Tesla Motors has an entire division dedicated to revolutionizing home energy. PowerWall, its home energy storage system, is increasing in popularity, while its solar panel division works on roofing tiles that can collect solar energy.

messages.body: $TSLA Why does the M3 have the quality of a 1970s era car? Panel gaps? Windows that don‚Äôt fit? https://jalopnik.com/tesla-model-3-teardown-by-engineering-firm-reveals-qual-1822678045

links.title: Tesla Model 3 Teardown By Engineering Firm Reveals Quality Flaws Like 'A Kia In The '90s'
links.description: For years, we've heard criticisms about Tesla's fit and finish, but now Sandy Munro-CEO of a Detroit-area consultancy that tears apart and studies automobiles-has seen a new Model 3 up close. His thoughts: "I can't imagine how they released this."
